projectPurpose: To provide a command-line tool for recording terminal sessions in a lightweight, text-based format and an ecosystem for replaying, sharing, and embedding these recordings.
mainFeatures: Records terminal sessions to lightweight .cast files
Replays recordings in terminal or web browser
Allows publishing recordings to asciinema.org or self-hosted servers

alternatives.name: script
mainFeatures: Records terminal session output to a file (typescript)

alternatives.name: ttyrec
mainFeatures: Records terminal session output and timing to .tty files

alternatives.name: Terminalizer
mainFeatures: Provides web player link for sharing
Supports custom frame styles for GIFs

alternatives.name: termtosvg
mainFeatures: Renders recordings as standalone SVG animations

marketPositioning: Asciinema is positioned as the leading open-source tool for recording and sharing terminal sessions in a lightweight, text-based format (.cast). It differentiates itself from traditional screen recorders by capturing terminal output as text and timing data, enabling features like copy-paste from playback, resolution independence, and smaller file sizes. Its integrated ecosystem (recorder, player, server) provides a comprehensive solution for technical demonstrations, tutorials, and troubleshooting, offering a modern, interactive alternative to static text logs or heavy video files. It competes with older tools like script and ttyrec by offering modern web sharing/embedding, and with GIF-generating tools by providing a more feature-rich, interactive playback experience via its dedicated player.
